channel.title: R.I.P. Jimi Hendrix (Music Thread)
channel.description:
Today (Sept.18) was the day [b][url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AIhtafqZvy8&t=1m39s']Jimi Hendrix[/url][/b] died :[
[b][u][url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WoAXW30mMAg&t=0m32s']The Greatest Guitar Player To Ever Live.[/url][/u][/b]
Anyone out there still like that kind of music? Anyone out there ever even touched a guitar?
I don't feel like today's music has the strength that music once had; people were so original and passionate about their music back in Jimi's time. It's not that I don't like modern music, it's just that for some reason, classic musicians like [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cnFSaqFzSO8&t=0m23s']Hendrix[/url] and [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vCWdCKPtnYE&feature=results_video&playnext=1&list=PL601A3520AC4EF619']Dylan[/url] never failed to make me smile to their tunes, while I have to dance around genres to find any music I like these days. Nothing fills the void like some badass guitar riffs. I guess I really just love my guitar music :stuck_out_tongue:
I guess opinion truly is a spectacle.
Regardless, does anyone have any musical opinion on this, or have a song they'd like to share?
I honestly love to listen to other people's musical opinions and why they enjoy their genre of music; anything from classical to techno, etc.
[i][COLOR='Cyan']Feel free to jump into any topic music-related.[/i]
[COLOR='Black']P.S. Sorry for dancing onto multiple topics..

item.title: R.I.P. Jimi Hendrix (Music Thread)
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
To belatedly answer your question:

Amon Tobin’s tough to describe. At his most basic he’s a mix of Trip Hop and Big Beat, but his later albums rely more and more on “real world” foley samples that he messes with, rather than sampling other songs for music. His earlier works have a lot of swing era samples going on.

Listening to two of his tracks back to back from those two different eras almost makes him sound like a completely different artist. I just happen to love it all, so I’ve got almost his entire discography.

Traffic- one from his first album, “Adventures in Foam.” At this point he recorded under the psudonym “Cujo.”

Four Ton Mantis - A more recent song, but still a ways into his back catalog. You can sort of see the transition to more sample-heavy music from here. This one is from “Supermodified.”

El Cargo - If you’ve played “Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory” this should sound quite familiar. In fact, this track and just about every other part of Chaos Theory’s music is what turned me on to Tobin in the first place. This is farther torwards the sampling end of his music style.

Goto 10 - From his most recent album “Isam.” And if you aren’t sufficiently prepared for his huge departure in style from his earlier work, this can sound like incoherent noise. But holy shit is it creative and innovative in how it’s almost entirely sampling based.

The reason I love Tobin’s work so much is because each album further evolves and changes his general sound, to the point where it’s nigh-unrecognizable, and yet it still sounds like a Tobin record. Few people manage to pull that off.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P. Jimi Hendrix (Music Thread)
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
bur:

oh ho ho arent we nice

my point was this: if you listen to it and like the music, it doesnt matter what genre it is
if you dont want to listen then you dont need to know what genre it is

Well, I wasn’t going to look into the artist that he said until he answered me. This is because his answer may or may not influence me to research them. I want to be compelled – I needed more info, that’s all.

geekofalltrades:

Rather than list every artist I listen to, I’m going to list the ones who are awesome but obscure, that way somebody might actually listen to one and have their musical horizons expanded.

Maktub
People in Planes
Eric Whitacre
Koop
Royksopp

My favorite song by Royksopp: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sDT4dE5yq0A

My two favorite song by People in Planes: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yOkgfyTY3Bs - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KUtPYx8k8l8

People in Planes’ song, “Fire,” is by far one of my favorite songs of all time.

YOU, my friend have [COLOR=‘Magenta’]GREAT taste.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P. Jimi Hendrix (Music Thread)
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
I listen to a wide range of musical styles, but it always comes in waves of different moods.

There’s the mellow, emo-ish mood with Dinosaur Jr, Swervedriver, Built to Spill, J Mascis (God!), Atmosphere, …

There’s the rebel-against-anything mood that has stuff like Sonic Youth, Nirvana, dan le sac vs Scroobius Pip (thank you whoever pointed that out to me), Smashing Pumpkins, …

Then there’s my happy-stomp-my-feet mood with Finntroll, Korpiklaani, Alestorm, …

Ye olde grrrrr mood with Pantera, Nile, Amon Amarth, Megadeth, Slayer, …

There’s also a fuck-I-feel-old mood with Cream/Clapton, BB King, Buddy Guy, Hendrix, Beatles, …

The I-feel-slightly-odd mood with Squarepusher, Aphex Twin, Mùm, Lo-bat, …

And a nigga-I-am-gangstah with Wu Tang, MF Doom, Dr Dre, Pharoahe Monch, Busta Rhymes, Tupac, …

There’s a couple more I forgot to mention (and a lot more bands per), but that’s the gist of it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
